question: How does increasing the suction head difference Δh affect infiltration according to the Green–Ampt model? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! Larger suction differences enhance infiltration, but if there is no moisture contrast (Δθ=0), Δh has no effect.
error: ❌ Not fully correct. Δh increases the driving force and accelerates infiltration, but has no effect when Δθ = 0.

question: Under which conditions does the long-term infiltration rate approach Ks in the Green–Ampt model? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! Long-term infiltration approaches Ks once the suction-driven part becomes small relative to gravity and conductivity.
error: ❌ Not correct. Only at long times does infiltration approach Ks; early infiltration is dominated by suction forces.

question: Which statements describe limitations of the Green–Ampt model? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! The Green–Ampt model simplifies real soil-water behavior, especially the wetting front representation.
error: ❌ Not fully correct. The model does not handle gradual transitions or layered soils well.

question: What does the shape of the infiltration rate curve i(t) typically show? (Mark ALL correct answers)
success: ✅ Correct! i(t) shows a strong initial decrease due to suction effects before approaching Ks.
error: ❌ Not fully correct. Infiltration rate does not increase; it declines and asymptotically approaches Ks.
